function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"IoT devices and healthcare networks can be vulnerable to cyber attacks, leading to unauthorized access and manipulation of critical medical data.","Impact":"Compromised patient data, inaccurate medical treatments, and potential endangerment of patient safety.","Mitigation":"Implementation of robust cybersecurity measures, regular security audits, and staff training on recognizing and preventing cyber threats.","Technologies":"Cybersecurity solutions, encryption, secure data transfer protocols, and network monitoring tools.","People":"Healthcare providers, medical staff, patients, and healthcare IT professionals.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, IT departments, and cybersecurity experts."},{"Description":"Reliance on real-time data and smart device connectivity may lead to errors and misinformation in disease tracking and patient diagnosis.","Impact":"Mismanaged patient care, delayed treatment, and inaccurate disease surveillance and reporting.","Mitigation":"Validation of data accuracy, redundancy in data collection methods, and regular calibration and maintenance of smart devices.","Technologies":"Data validation algorithms, data quality control tools, device calibration technology, and redundant data collection systems.","People":"Healthcare providers, medical staff, public health officials, and patients.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, public health agencies, and medical device manufacturers."},{"Description":"Potential over-reliance on IoT technology may lead to complacency and reduced human oversight in healthcare decision-making.","Impact":"Increased risk of misdiagnosis, inadequate patient care, and lack of critical judgment in treatment procedures.","Mitigation":"Balancing IoT technology with human expertise, continuous training and education on best practices, and establishing clear protocols for human intervention in medical decision-making.","Technologies":"Decision support systems, training simulators, and human-machine collaboration interfaces.","People":"Healthcare providers, medical staff, and patients.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, medical training institutions, and regulatory bodies."}]}
